name: <Head>
info: # Objects placed in the head section (html) ## Toolbar Ui ## Solar indices - from [n0nbh](https://www.hamqsl.com) SFi -Solar Flux activiy at 10.7 cm A - Daily average level for geomagnetic activity K - The K-index quantifies disturbances in the horizontal component of earth's magnetic field with an integer in the range 0â€“9 G - GeoMagentic Storm - G0 = None Predicted, G1 = Minor, G2 = Moderate, G3 = Strong, G4, Severe, G5 Extreme ## Current Wx - Data from [openweathermap](https://openweathermap.org/) Temp Wind Direction / Speed Sky Conditions Barometric Trend - up/down/level ## Lightning Distance to last strike - Set distance in user config node -strike_distance Time to last strike - Time in 1-59min, 1-24hrs, 1-~day. Default is 180 day before 1st strike is recorded ## UTC Clock Current format is 4/13/22, 20:00 UTC ` function displayTime() { var d = Date(); var options = { timeZone: 'UTC', timeZoneName: 'short', year: '2-digit', month: 'numeric', day: 'numeric', hourCycle: 'h23', hour: `2-digit`, minute: `2-digit`}; p.text(new Date().toLocaleString('en-US', options)); }` The format is based on toLocaleString based formats. See documentation W3_Schools_toLocaleString

name: getSolar
info:
# getSolar

## HTTP request node to fetch solar indicies data from https://www.hamqsl.com/w8bexml.php

Data is returned in xml format

object
solar: object
solardata: array[1]
0: object
source: array[1]
updated: array[1]
solarflux: array[1]
aindex: array[1]
kindex: array[1]
kindexnt: array[1]
xray: array[1]
sunspots: array[1]
heliumline: array[1]
protonflux: array[1]
electonflux: array[1]
aurora: array[1]
normalization: array[1]
latdegree: array[1]
solarwind: array[1]
magneticfield: array[1]
calculatedconditions: array[1]
calculatedvhfconditions: array[1]
geomagfield: array[1]
signalnoise: array[1]
fof2: array[1]
muffactor: array[1]
muf: array[1]

name: User Config
func:
//  default values for lightning detection 
let lat_home = flow.set("lat_home",'35.007'); //set for your locale
let long_home = flow.set("long_home", '-117.639'); //set for your locale
let strike_distance = flow.set("strike_distance", 200); // set for strike detection radius (i.e 200 Km/Miles)
let strike_reset = flow.set("strike_reset",30000); // milliseconds
let distance_unit = flow.set("distance_unit", 'mi'); // km = Kilometer, mi = Miles
let tempUnit = flow.set("tempUnit",'f');  // f = Farenheight, c= Celsius

name: Load CSS
Toolbar UI
info:
# Solar / Wx / Lightning / Clock

1. solar data from Solar flow variables:  #kdx, #sfi, #Aindex

2.  Open Weather icons for current conditions: Temp, Wind Dir / Speed, Current Conditions,  Barometric Trend

3. Lightning Strike Distance - If < 25Km, then distance in miles is shown.  >25Km distance default.
4. Lightning Stirke Icon - When < 15Km,  Icon = Red.  >25Km = green.
5. Last Strike - Time from last strike in min(1-59), hrs(1-23), and day(1-~).  Last time is determined when strike occurs.  Default is 180 days if variable is undefined.

6. UTC Clock with seconds

name: scopeWatch - See Info
info:
# Jquery script to detect message changes and update the browser tool bar

 One UI Template is needed for each Web Page on your dashboard that you wish to update 
 This flow has 2 web pages. 
 
 There are 2 Ui templates in the scope watch group, one for each page.  The 2nd page is only for demonstration.  If you want to update the header on multiple pages you will need to have a Ui template for each page.
 If you only have one page you can delete the last Ui template.  If you have more than 2 pages you will need to copy/past a new Ui template and configure to hide the card.

 Each Ui node needs to have the card hidden. Verify the UI  `node-id` is correct.

Example of node id in Ui Node:

`         $('[node-id="e3a5c21d8df5db34"]').hide();
`

Find the Ui `node-id` selecting the node and then click on the info 'i' tab to see the `node-id`
The Id will correspond to the `node-id` in the Ui Node.  Copy the  `node-id` value from the info tab and the replace the `node-id` with the copied value.

name: formatSolar
Readme 1st! Click on Info tab then click me!!
info: # **Tool Bar Objects that have the following objects that display on the Node-RED toolbar** ## Solar Indices : OpenWeather Current Indices : blitzuntorg lightning alert : UTC Clock --- # **Flow Information** # **CSS** # This flow was developed on node-red version 3.x. The flow uses a CSS template node # If you use a CSS template node in your current production enviornment you will need to copy the contents of the 'Load CSS' template node into your production CSS template node. Disable the Load CSS template node to avoid conflicts. # **Node Dependencies** ## node-red-node-openweathermap # **Update Toolbar UI** # This flow contains duplicate template nodes to update Page1 and Page2. Page 2 is only for demonstration. If you have multiple pages you need the toolbar to display on then you will need to have a UI template in one group assigned to a web page. Pages with multiple groups only need one instance. In order to keep the UI template from beeing rendered on the web page you have to hide the card. This requires updating the node id of the UI template in the code. See the scopeWatch comment for details --- # **Solar Indices** ## SFI, A, K, and Geomagnetic (G) - The G is derived from the Kpi values and if there is no Geomagentic json alerts from noaa then it will default to 0 # **Current Wx information for your locale** ## Temp; (F°/C°), Wind dir and speed (mph/km), current conditions (cloudy), and barometric trend ( up, down , flat). Data is based on last condition timestamp (5 min) ## You will need to register with https://openweathermap.org/ and request an api key. Once you have your key you can set the OpenWx node to your local. ## Find the Open WX node and open to edit. --- --- ## add your api key and set your locale. ## --- # **Lightning Detection** ## Lightning detecion is derived from blitzuntorg.org. The Ui display shows the default radius distance in mi/km, a lightning indicator:green indicates radius distance, red indicates actual strike and distance. The last strike time is displayed last. The default value when restarting node-red is 180 days. The value will show a lighting strike last time in minutes (0 - 59), hours ( 0-23 ), and days ( 1 - ~). ## Below is the view of a strike that has just occured. The radius distance is replaced with the actual strike distance ## Below is the view of the lastStrike counter. The distance resets to show the radius distance --- ## The intial config is set by the startup function --- ## The intial config sets the default values for lightning detection `// default values for lightning detection` `let lat_home = flow.set("lat_home",'39.280430'); //set for your locale` `let long_home = flow.set("long_home", '-77.886821'); //set for your locale` `let strike_distance = flow.set("strike_distance", 200); // set for strike detection radius (i.e 200 Km/Miles)` `let strike_reset = flow.set("strike_reset",30000); // milliseconds` `let distance_unit = flow.set("distance_unit", 'km'); // km = Kilometer, mi = Miles` `let tempUnit = flow.set("tempUnit",'f'); // f = Farenheight, c= Celsius` --- ## The config can be changed on the ui by using the ui config UI config panel. --- Note that You will need to set the KM/Mi radio button inorder for the unit to display on the Ui toolbar. --- # **A UTC clock that shows the data in 24-hour clock (hours, minutes, seconds.)** --- # **Update Intervals** ## When the flow is 1st initalized the Default Settings Group fires once to set the default values. ## Solar Indices are updatesd via the Update group. The default time is 1/min ## OpenWeather Indices are updates every 5 minutes. The free version of the API only allows for 1440 data fetches/day. This is not enough to allow 1/min fetches. ## blitzuntorg data for lightning strikes update when the strike is detected. When a strike is detected it will remain on the toolbar until the Current Strike Reset interval has elapsed. The default is 30 seconds. The lastStrike value is updated 1/min from the Update Group. --- EOF

name: function 1
func:
await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 2000));
return msg = {payload: new Date().getTime()}

name: Toolbar UI
info:
# Solar / Wx / Lightning / Clock

1. solar data from Solar flow variables:  #kdx, #sfi, #Aindex

2.  Open Weather icons for current conditions: Temp, Wind Dir / Speed, Current Conditions,  Barometric Trend

3. Lightning Strike Distance - If < 25Km, then distance in miles is shown.  >25Km distance default.
4. Lightning Stirke Icon - When < 15Km,  Icon = Red.  >25Km = green.
5. Last Strike - Time from last strike in min(1-59), hrs(1-23), and day(1-~).  Last time is determined when strike occurs.  Default is 180 days if variable is undefined.

6. UTC Clock with seconds

name: UTC Clock in Header
format:
<script id="toolbar" type="text/javascript">
    var clockInterval;
    $(function () {
        if (clockInterval) return;

        // add PST Clock
        var div1 = $('<div/>');
        var p = $('<p/>');
        div1.append(p);
        div1[0].style.margin = 'auto';
        div1[0].style.display = 'flex';
     
        // add UTC clock
        var div2 = $('<div/>');
        var u = $('<p/>');
        div2.append(u);
        //div2[0].style.margin = 'auto';
        div2[0].style.margin = '5px 5px 5px 140px';
        div2[0].style.display = 'flex';


        function displayTime() {
            var d = Date();
            var utcoptions = { timeZone: 'UTC', timeZoneName: 'short' , hourCycle: 'h23', hour: `2-digit`, minute: `2-digit`};
            var pstoptions = { timeZone: 'PST', timeZoneName: 'short' , hourCycle: 'h23', hour: `2-digit`, minute: `2-digit`};
            u.text(new Date().toLocaleString('en-US', utcoptions));
            p.text(new Date().toLocaleString('en-US', pstoptions));
        }

        clockInterval = setInterval(displayTime, 1000);

        //add to toolbar when it's available
        var addToToolbarTimer;
        
        function addToToolbar() {
            var toolbar = $('.md-toolbar-tools');
            
            if(!toolbar.length) return;
            
            toolbar.append(div1);
            toolbar.append(div2);

            clearInterval(addToToolbarTimer);
        }
        addToToolbarTimer = setInterval(addToToolbar, 200);
    });
</script>

Solar
format:
<script>
    (function(scope) {
        //hide this card. NOTE: 4b689f7473831a84 is the Node id as 
        //seen in the INFO panel on the sidebar when you select this node
         $('[node-id="5d0aa4a3c138d962"]').hide();
        scope.$watch('msg', function(msg) {
            if (msg && msg.topic == "solar") {
                $("#header-sfi").text(msg.sfi).css("color",(msg.sficolor));
                $("#header-Aindex").text(msg.Aindex).css("color",(msg.aColor));
                $("#header-kdx").text(msg.kdx).css("color",(msg.kColor));
            }
        });
    })(scope);
</script>

name: Wx
Flow to show tool bars on top of each tab - tabs must beadded manually and node id changed as commented below for browser refresh to work
Add new tabs here for both WX and solar display. Make sure to change node IDs (see info/script for how to do this on nodes
Add new tabs here for both WX and solar display. Make sure to change node IDs (see info/script for how to do this on nodes
Solar
format:
<script>
    (function(scope) {
        //hide this card. NOTE: c8cbd4647a317b48 is the Node id as 
        //seen in the INFO panel on the sidebar when you select this node
         $('[node-id="2adf6d67d1e2e638"]').hide();
        scope.$watch('msg', function(msg) {
            if (msg && msg.topic == "solar") {
                $("#header-sfi").text(msg.sfi).css("color",(msg.sficolor));
                $("#header-Aindex").text(msg.Aindex).css("color",(msg.aColor));
                $("#header-kdx").text(msg.kdx).css("color",(msg.kColor));
            }
        });
    })(scope);
</script>

# Node links to Solar Flow logic for K index varible #kdx

Node needs to be in one flow for each dashboard tab in order for toolbar to update

name: Wx
Solar
format:
<script>
    (function(scope) {
        //hide this card. NOTE: c8cbd4647a317b48 is the Node id as 
        //seen in the INFO panel on the sidebar when you select this node
         $('[node-id="68969bb5c6b86fd4"]').hide();
        scope.$watch('msg', function(msg) {
            if (msg && msg.topic == "solar") {
                $("#header-sfi").text(msg.sfi).css("color",(msg.sficolor));
                $("#header-Aindex").text(msg.Aindex).css("color",(msg.aColor));
                $("#header-kdx").text(msg.kdx).css("color",(msg.kColor));
            }
        });
    })(scope);
</script>
